Welcome to /htg/, the Helltaker game general.
Post art, gameplay, tips, how much you want to [cuddle] a demon, autistic fanfic, whatever is related to the game.

>"What is Helltaker?"
Helltaker is short, free to play puzzle game in which you control a man who journeys into the depths to Hell to make a dream of creating a harem of sharp dressed demon girls a reality.

>"Why /htg/ and not something shorter?"
Because "/hg/" is used by Halo General.

>"Why a general for an hour-long game?"
Apart from typical waifu autism, Vanripper, Helltaker's creator, had considered making the game open source, meaning fan-made content and expansions.
Fan projects are also on the table, such as spin-off games, mods, and dating sims!

>Where are we playing?

LIVE: Everlook (Vanilla) x1
>Progressive vanilla fresh by Whitekidney & former LH staff.

Turtle WoW (Vanilla) x1 - x2
>A Vanilla+ PvE-RP server with lots of custom content and class changes.

Ascension (WoTLK Custom)
>Classless gameplay with 2 servers, static & seasonal. Create and customize your own build.

Project Epoch (Vanilla+) x1
>A vanilla+ server running on the 3.3.5 client with TBC talents & spells - currently in Open Beta

ChromieCraft (WotLK) x1
>A Wrath-client based server progressing through Vanilla, TBC and eventually WotLK. Currently in the Vanilla phase.

Warmane-Lordaeron (WotLK) x1
>WotLK server without a cash shop, has a small RP community.

Mistblade (MoP) x3
>A MoP server with an active /wpsg/ raiding guild.
<Khazar Milkers> is the active wpsg guild, join their discord and contact an officer if you're interested in raiding with them.

>How do I connect to [server]?
1. Register on a private server that hosts the same game client you have.
2. Copy their realmlist URL. This can usually be found on the main page of the website or on their registration page.
3. Look for a realmlist.wtf file in your WoW folder. This may either be in the root folder, or inside Wow/Data/enUS/
4. Open the realmlist.wtf file in a text editor such as Notepad and paste in the realmlist settings of the server. Make sure it starts with 'set realmlist' followed by the realmlist URL.

>FAQ
> "What is Marvel Snap?"
The newest Digital CCG from the creators of Hearthstone. A deck is 12 card singleton, games are only 6 rounds long and players play simultaneous turns to three lanes/locations. Winning two lanes wins the match.
A match is played for Ladder Points (Cosmic Cubes) and each player can SNAP once per match to double the stakes (from 1 point to max 8 points).
> "How do I collect cards?"
As you upgrade your cards cosmetic level, your "player level" (Collection Level/CL) increases. Progressing your Collection Level unlocks more cards.
> "What to spend my Gold on?"
Battle Pass is only purchased with money, Gold goes to buying the Variants you want most, Credits, or Refreshing Daily Missions (Refresh > Credits). Credit cap is 5k.
> "What is a Card Pool?"
Cards unlock in a random order, but specific cards are unlocked within specific CL ranges: Pool One cards (CL 18 - 214), Pool Two (CL 222 - 474), and Pool Three (474 and up).
> "How do I know who has priority / who flips first?"
The player with the greatest point lead flips cards first. Can also be discerned by which player name is highlighted in gold.
> "What features are in the works?"
Unranked Mode, Battle vs. Friends, a real PC Widescreen UI, and new "Collectors Tokens" which will allow you to target specific cards you want but don't have yet, and more.

>I want to read Marvel comics, where do I start?

The Wheel has turned once again

LANTERN Edition

Dominions is a fantasy turn-based war game created by two dudes. One of them is a teacher.
The game combines a simple presentation with an extremely wide array of strategic options, including over 3000 units, 900 spells and 400 magic items. Turns are resolved simultaneously, with players planning battles rather than directly controlling them.
It has simplistic graphics but is easily moddable and extremely deep.
Basically, it's an autist’s wet dream of a war game.

>Tips for beginners
Learn to pick your fights, don't hesitate to run away and don't reload unless you die, any fight you survive makes you stronger. Always carry healing supplies.
Building an outpost will attract trader caravans and hostile raids. Building one too early might be more than you can handle.
Pressing F1 will open the tutorial screen. Mousing over the stats screen and HUD will reveal useful tooltips and additional info.
Before asking questions, consider if you can easily answer them yourself. Learning and exploring is a big part of the game. Remember that only you can decide what is fun for (You).

>What the heck is this
/indie/ is the general for all indie games, such as Age of Decadence, A Hat in Time, Axiom Verge, Baba Is You, Battle Brothers, Battlerite, Card City Nights 2, Cave Story, CrossCode, Cultist Simulator, Darkest Dungeon, Darkwood, DashBored, Dead Cells, The Desolate Hope, Disco Elysium, Environmental Station Alpha, FTL, Guacamelee!, Hollow Knight: Silksong, Knytt, LISA, Lobotomy Corp, Loop Hero, Machinarium, Middens, Monolith, Monster Train, Noita, OFF, OneShot, Rimworld, Rain World, Slap City, Slay the Spire, Starsector, Subnautica, Sunless Skies, Underrail, VA-11 HALL-A, Yume Nikki, etc., as well as other games that just don't fit in any other general such as Atelier, Pillars of Eternity, Rayman, and Valkyria Chronicles. /jrpg/ is welcome. Idle, roguelite, shmup, and RPGMaker games are cool too.

Mobile or consoles, Flash or Unity, freeware or early access. This place is a home for the indie game community and indie and obscure games that don't have a home. So be free to talk and share all your hidden gems, forgotten games and starving devs here.

>Can I talk about games that already have a general?
We mostly discuss games that are not popular enough for their own threads, however, all indie games are allowed. So talk about them if you want, but don't overdo it since you already have other generals for that.

threads.com:
Shocking, I know Edition

Previously on /mvsg/: >>406931290

>What is MultiVersus?
Multiversus is a platform fighter focused on 2v2 gameplay. The game features characters from multiple Warner Brothers intellectual properties. You can play singles too.

>Is it actually free?
It is free, yes. While there are microtransactions in the game (of course) and Founder's Pack's available for sale filled with digital goods including "character tickets" to unlock characters without spending gold or the premium currency "gleamium".
Characters can be unlocked through in-game currency earned by doing challenges in games or premium currency. If you play locally all of the characters are unlocked for free to play offline.

>Will netcode be improved?
According to director Tony Huynh, it is their current highest priority.
https://twitter.com/Tony_Huynh/status/1590107151699431425

>Newest characters:
Lebron James (released on July 22)
Morty (released August 23)
Gizmo (released September 8th)
Rick (released September 27th)
Stripe (released October 12th)
Black Adam (released October 31st)
Possible upcoming characters based on leaked voice lines: Marvin, Joker, Raven, Beetlejuice, Wicked Witch of the West

>Will MultiVersus be affected by the Warner/Discovery merger?
As far as PFG knows, no. It has been confirmed by the director himself.
https://twitter.com/Tony_Huynh/status/1555046320624193536?cxt=HHwWgMCq4feY0ZQrAAAA (embed)

>Where do I view the current leaderboards?
https://tracker.gg/multiversus

>What perks do I use?
See the /mvsg/ perk guide
https://imgur.com/eKPL0yj

>Anything else?
The game is on PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One and Xbox Series consoles. The game has cross-play as well as cross-progression: all of your stuff is saved on your WB account, so you can play on two different platforms and still have your unlocks.

Previous Thread: >>404237975

Life is Strange is an episodic interactive drama from DONTNOD Entertainment. Set in the Pacific Northwest in the town of Arcadia Bay, the player follows the story of Maxine Caulfield and her seemingly newfound ability to turn hella gay and rewind time. At the prestigious Blackwell Academy, Max must prepare with Chloe Price for the incoming storm of returning to her hometown after five years. Available on Steam, PSN and Xbox Live.

Life is Strange: True Colors is a narrative adventure featuring Alex Chen, a young woman with an astonishing supernatural power, through which she can experience the strong emotions of others. While Alex’s power will lead to moments of great Joy, it also brings her into the orbit of violent Anger, world-altering Sadness, and irrepressible Fear. As she probes the mysteries of Haven Springs, revealing its secrets, Alex will discover moments of quiet transcendence – but also be drawn into moments of sudden, bloody violence - with lasting consequences.

>FAQ
> "What is Marvel Snap?"
The newest Digital CCG from the creators of Hearthstone. A deck is 12 card singleton, games are only 6 rounds long and players play simultaneous turns to three lanes/locations. Winning two lanes wins the match.
A match is played for Ladder Points (Cosmic Cubes) and each player can SNAP once per match to double the stakes (from 1 point to max 8 points).
> "How do I collect cards?"
As you upgrade your cards cosmetic level, your "player level" (Collection Level/CL) increases. Progressing your Collection Level unlocks more cards.
> "What to spend my Gold on?"
Battle Pass is only purchased with money, Gold goes to buying the Variants you want most, Credits, or Refreshing Daily Missions (Refresh > Credits). Credit cap is 5k.
> "What is a Card Pool?"
Cards unlock in a random order, but specific cards are unlocked within specific CL ranges: Pool One cards (CL 18 - 214), Pool Two (CL 222 - 474), and Pool Three (474 and up).
> "How do I know who has priority / who flips first?"
The player with the greatest point lead flips cards first. Can also be discerned by which player name is highlighted in gold.
> "What features are in the works?"
Unranked Mode, Battle vs. Friends, a real PC Widescreen UI, and new "Collectors Tokens" which will allow you to target specific cards you want but don't have yet, and more.
